subject: Cybersecurity
title: The OSI Model: Seven Layers of Communication
description: Learn The OSI Model: Seven Layers of Communication in one minute.

hook.text: Every message you send online passes through seven invisible layers â€” each one a potential attack surface.

buildup.text: The OSI model divides networking into seven layers: physical, data link, network, transport, session.

discovery.text: Each layer has a specific job. Attackers target specific layers depending on what they want to accomplish.

twist.text: Most people interact only with Layer 7 (applications). Attackers exploit layers 2-4, where defenses are often weakest.

climax.text: Understanding the OSI model is understanding where attacks happen and where defenses must be placed.

punchline.text: Seven layers. Each one a potential door for attackers.

quiz.question: Why is the OSI model important for cybersecurity?
options: Each layer represents a potential attack surface that needs defense
